channel.title: Starter command help?
channel.description: Ehm... so on my devolution 7 source I managed to add the starter command, but the only problem is you can type ::starter more than once, and I need to try to make sure you can only type it once so the econonmy stays good :P. Any help on how to do that, help is appreciated :D

item.title: Starter command help?
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Yeah search for something that is already in char files and copy and paste it changing all the names etc cause otherwise starter = 1 and starter == 0 are gonna want to be different things like boolean and ints XD

Read full topic

item.title: Starter command help?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Power For It:

ty man and im not gonna copy and paste this like a noob I can add this from another source I have because now i know instead of server = 1 its suppose to be VARIABLE!

The ‘variable’ is whatever you want it to be, but you must declare it, write it into the character files, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Starter command help?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter") && variable == 0) { // Add items variable = 1; else sendMessage("You've already gotten your starter!"); }
That’s just a start.

Read full topic

item.title: Starter command help?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

umm i dont know exactly but i would take a look at lets say like figments source or a delta source with a ::starter and take ideas from there of course the codes wont be written the same considering they are both different but itll give you an idea on how to do it…

Read full topic

item.title: Starter command help?
